text:
1 Fun with Words

Learning Track
Domains
Cognitive Development
Development of Literacy
Physical Development

Curricular Goals
CG-2, CG-3, CG-7, CG-9,
CG-10, CG-11, CG-13

Competencies
C-2.1, C-2.2, C-3.1, C-3.2,
C-7.1, C-7.2, C-9.1, C-9.3,
C-9.4, C-9.5, C-9.7, C-10.1,
C-10.2, C-10.3, C-11.1,
C-11.2, C-13.1, C-13.2,
C-13.3, C-13.4

Skills
Critical thinking
Problem-solving
Creative thinking
Communication
Initiative and self-direction
Collaboration

P1 Take-off!
• Reading the names of pictures and
identifying the vowels

P2,P3 Reading and comprehension (Guided practice)
• Enjoy the poem with phonic word play
• Answer questions based on the rhymes

P4 Vocabulary and Pronunciation
• Identifying the correct name of a picture
• Identifying the name of a picture and
writing the missing vowel

P5 Grammar
• Naming words—nouns

P6,P7 Listening and Speaking
• Listening and repeating the rhyming words
• Listening to a description and using it to
describe oneself in the same way

P8 Writing (Guided practice)
• Identify the rhyming words

P9 It’s Work Time! (Independent practice)
• Do tasks/Answer questions based on the
knowledge gained

P10 Experiential Learning
• Reading the sentence and colouring the
correct picture

P11 Aptitude Time (Independent practice)

Learning Outcomes
Fun with Words
Through the course of the lesson
1. Students gain
• vocabulary skills
• communication skills
• reading and writing skills
2. Students learn
• to link consonants and vowels
• to recognize the phonemic sounds and symbols for consonants and vowels
3. Students discover
• the blend of consonants within and between words
4. Students develop
• skills to identify and produce clear sounds for vowels
and consonants
• pronunciation skills to utter simple words correctly

Take-off!

Observe and read the names of the given pictures. Circle the letters a, e, i,
o, and u in the names. One has been done for you.

bug bin bed tap
top pen bat cup
pot bun boy nut
mat cow

Kitty was a big cat.
She sat on a mat.
She wore a red hat.
A rat saw the cat.
HHee wwaanntteedd ttoo ggiivvee hheerr aa ppaatt..
But, his tail was stuck under the bat.

Rhyming words
red bed
saw draw

I saw a little bee.
That was sitting on a tree.
I climbed to see.
There I saw three.
Phew! I jumped off the tree.
I fell and hurt my knee

FA
1. Is Kitty a rat or a cat?
Kitty is a .................... .
2. Kitty wore a .................... hat.
a. blue b. red c. green d. orange
3. There were .................... bees on the tree.
a. four b. three c. two d. one

Bob had a tiny dog.
Bob and the dog went for a walk.
The street was full of fog.
So, the dog sat on the log and looked
at the frog.

Shelly had a shell.
She stuck it on a bell.
Nice! I shall tell.
She has done it very well.

Red is the colour of cherry.
Blue is the colour of berry.
Purple is the colour of raspberry.
My garden has lots to carry.
Mother can make some juice from gooseberry.

FA
1. Bob had a tiny .................... .
a. cat b. dog c. turtle d. fish
2. Shelly stuck the shell on a .................... .
a. wall b. bell c. paper d. doll

Rhyming words
walk chalk
shell fell
berry ferry

Look at the sun and the bug.
The bug is enjoying the sun.
The bug is snug on a rug.
The sun, too, is having fun.

FA
The bug is enjoying the ............................ .
a. rug b. mug c. sun d. fun

Rhyming words
sun run
bug mug

FA
Which rhyme does the picture above
remind you of? Sing it in class.

EXERCISES

Comprehension

1. Look at each picture and tick () the correct sentences.
a. (1) Kitty wore a blue hat.
(2) Kitty sat on a mat.
(3) Kitty saw a rat.
(4) The rat’s tail was stuck under a chair.
b. (1) Bob had a tiny cat.
(2) The street was full of leaves.
(3) The dog sat on the log.
(4) The dog looked at a rat.
c. (1) The bug is on the rug.
(2) The bug is sleeping.
(3) The sun is sad.
(4) The sun is having fun.

2. Choose the correct answer and fill in the blanks.
a. A __________ (rat/sat/bat/pat) saw the cat.
b. I fell and hurt my __________(feet/knee/bee/see).
c. Shelly had a __________ (bell/shell/sell/fell).
d. __________ (Purple/Red/Orange/Blue) is the colour of
raspberry.
e. The bug was snug on a __________ (rug/mat/chair/bed).

3. Answer the following questions.
a. What was the colour of Kitty’s hat?
Kitty wore a __________ (blue/red/green/pink) hat.

b. Which animal did Bob have?
Bob had a __________ (cat/dog/rat/parrot).
c. What did Shelly do with the bell?
Shelly stuck a __________ (shell/sticker/paper/bead) onthe bell.
d. Which fruit can mother use to make juice?
Mother can use __________ (cherry/gooseberry/raspberry/berry) to make juice.
e. How was the sun feeling?
The sun was __________ (having fun/sad/happy/unhappy).


Vocabulary and Pronunciation

(names of things)
1. Tick (✓) the name of the given picture.
a.
tap
cap
map

b.
fin
tin
pin

c.
tug
hug
bug

d.
hen
pen
den

e.
box
ox
fox

f.
dam
jam
ram

(identifying vowels)
2. Say the names of the given pictures and write the missing vowels.

Grammar

(naming words—nouns)
What are naming words?

Naming words are the
names given to animals,
places, things, and people.

Identify the pictures and say their names aloud.
chair
Maya
Raju
table

These are examples of naming words.

Look around your classroom. Everything around us has a name.
teacher
blackboard
door
fan
flower
book
bird
girl
boy
book
window
chair
table
desk
bag
dustbin

People have names.
Examples: Meera, Rohan, Sam, Ankit, and so on
Animals have names.
Examples: horse, dog, cow,
lion, and so on

Places have names.
Examples: Chennai, Delhi, Mumbai, Kolkata, and so on
Things have names.
Examples: table, chair, television, cupboard, and so on
Naming words are also known as nouns.

1. Name any two things around you.
a.
b.
2. Name any two people around you.
a.
b.

Listening and Speaking

(listening and repeating rhyming words)
1. Listen to your teacher say the rhyming words and repeat after her.
bat cat fat hat
bad dad had mad
cap map nap tap
can fan man pan

(describing oneself with picture and oral cues)
2. Listen to your teacher read each sentence. Now, take turns to describe
yourself using these pointers.
This is Sara.
Sara has two eyes. She uses them to see the things around her.
Sara has one nose. She uses it to smell.
Sara uses her mouth to eat.
She uses her hands to clap.
Sara uses her legs to walk.
Sara uses her ears to hear.

Writing

(rhyming words)
Choose a rhyming word from the box and write them on the blank.

1. bun 2. mug
tap
sun
3. cap mat 4. pan
nut
bell
5. dot 6. ox
bug
pin
man
7. hut 8. bin
cot
box
9. rat 10. well

It’s Work Time!
1. Read the lines and tick () the correct statements.
a. Shelly had a shell.
She stuck it on a bell.
Nice! I shall tell.
She has done it very well.
(1) ‘Shelly’ is not a naming word.
(2) The words ‘shell’ and ‘bell’ are rhyming words.
(3) The words ‘tell’ and ‘well’ are also rhyming words.

b. Red is the colour of cherry.
Blue is the colour of berry.
Purple is the colour of raspberry.
My garden has lots to carry.
Mother can make some juice from gooseberry.
(1) The colour of berry is red.
(2) The colour of cherry is blue.
(3) Mother can make juice from gooseberry.

2. Cross out (X) the words that do not rhyme in each row.
a. cat pat mug bat mat
b. bug big mug hug jug
c. bin tin nib win pin
d. top pop mop cop pup
e. dam man pan tan fan

Experiential Learning

Read aloud the following. Colour the correct pictures.

1. This is Logan. He is cutting a log with his wooden axe.

2. Carl is a tall man. He is jumping over the wall to catch a ball.

Aptitude Time
Duration: 15 minutes

Level of Aptitude—Easy
1. Which one of the following does not rhyme with ‘cat’?
a. mat b. hat c. cow d. sat

2. Find the word that rhymes with ‘hen’.
a. sun b. pen c. fun d. chain

3. Write the missing letters:
b ... n ... n ...
a. a, a, a
b. e, a, a
c. a, e, a
d. e, e, a

4. Rahul puts a lid on the jam bottle. Where is the lid?
a. on the jam bottle
b. on Rahul
c. on the floor
d. with Rahul

Level of Aptitude—Medium
5. Find the odd one.
a. map b. dad c. cap d. tap

6. Complete the sentence:
Sara puts some jam and ham in the __________.
a. pan b. fan c. can d. ran

7. Which of the following words cannot be formed from the word BATHROOM?
a. room b. broom c. soon d. bath

Level of Aptitude—Difficult
8. Find the naming words in the sentence:
There are many desks in my classroom.
a. many, desks b. desks, classroom
c. there, many d. many, classroom

9. Observe the following word pairs:
flowers—smell table—chair
Similarly, complete the following:
library— __________ socks— __________
a. lunch, leg b. read, bag
c. books, shoes d. uniform, pencil box

10. Write a naming word using the letters ‘a’, ‘t’, and ‘n’.

Self-assessment
I can read simple sentences.
I can tell the rhyming words in a rhyme.
I know what naming words are.
